intro: Euphrasia tarokoana, commonly known as the Taroko beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
